alert.note: Alert for Bourbon; Fayette; Harrison; Nicholas; Scott (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 11:41PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN SCOTT...BOURBON... NICHOLAS...NORTHEASTERN FAYETTE AND SOUTH CENTRAL HARRISON COUNTIES THROUGH 1215 AM EDT... At 1141 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fairview to near Carlisle to 7 miles west of Paris. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Georgetown, Paris, Carlisle, Millersburg, North Middletown, Blacks Crossroads, Hutchison, Ellisville, Stony Point and Bunker Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
